intro: Galium scabriusculum, commonly known as rough bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that disperses seeds by wind. Galium scabriusculum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands.
